info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 7:53PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORM IN SOUTH CENTRAL MASSACHUSETTS... At 752 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Palmer, or 12 miles northeast of Springfield, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Strong winds could cause minor damage such as downed branches. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Warren, West Brookfield and Brimfield around 805 PM EDT. Brookfield around 810 PM EDT. Southbridge, Sturbridge, North Brookfield and East Brookfield around 815 PM EDT. Oakham around 820 PM EDT. Charlton, Spencer and Leicester around 825 PM EDT. Auburn, Oxford and Douglas around 835 PM EDT. Worcester and Millbury around 840 PM EDT. Shrewsbury, Grafton and Sutton around 845 PM EDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed. Do not drive through flooded roads or underpasses. Avoid low lying areas near small streams. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for western, central and northeastern Massachusetts.
